verses.verse: Then Deborah <WH1683> and Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> sang <WH7891> on that day, <WH3117> saying, <WH559>
"Because the leaders took the lead <WH6544> in Israel, <WH3478> because the people <WH5971> offered <WH5068> themselves willingly, <WH1288> be blessed, Yahweh! <WH3068>

"Hear, <WH8085> you kings! <WH4428> Give ear, <WH238> you princes! <WH7336> I, <WH7891> even I, will sing to Yahweh. <WH3068> I will sing <WH2167> praise to Yahweh, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel. <WH3478>

"Yahweh, <WH3068> when you went forth <WH3318> out of Seir, <WH8165> when you marched out <WH6805> of the field <WH7704> of Edom, <WH123> the earth <WH776> trembled, <WH7493> the sky <WH8064> also dropped. <WH5197> Yes, <WH5645> the clouds dropped <WH5197> water. <WH4325>
The mountains <WH2022> quaked <WH5140> at the presence <WH6440> of Yahweh, <WH3068> even Sinai, <WH5514> at the presence <WH6440> of Yahweh, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel. <WH3478>

"In the days <WH3117> of Shamgar <WH8044> the son <WH1121> of Anath, <WH6067> in the days <WH3117> of Jael, <WH3278> the highways <WH734> were unoccupied. <WH2308> The travelers <WH1980> walked <WH3212> through byways. <WH6128>
The rulers <WH6520> ceased <WH2308> in Israel. <WH3478> They ceased <WH2308> until I, <WH1683> Deborah, arose; <WH6965> Until I arose <WH6965> a mother <WH517> in Israel. <WH3478>

They chose <WH977> new <WH2319> gods. <WH430> Then war <WH3901> was in the gates. <WH8179> Was there a shield <WH4043> or spear <WH7420> seen <WH7200> among forty <WH705> thousand <WH505> in Israel? <WH3478>
My heart <WH3820> is toward the governors <WH2710> of Israel, <WH3478> who offered themselves willingly <WH5068> among the people. <WH5971> Bless <WH1288> Yahweh! <WH3068>
"Speak, <WH7878> you who ride <WH7392> on white <WH6715> donkeys, <WH860> you who sit <WH3427> on rich carpets, <WH4055> and you who walk <WH1980> by the way. <WH1870>

Far from the noise <WH6963> of archers, <WH2686> in the places of drawing water, <WH4857> there they will rehearse <WH8567> the righteous acts <WH6666> of Yahweh, <WH3068> the righteous acts <WH6666> of his rule <WH6520> in Israel. <WH3478> "Then the people <WH5971> of Yahweh <WH3068> went down <WH3381> to the gates. <WH8179>

<WH5782> 'Awake, awake, <WH5782> Deborah! <WH1683> Awake, <WH5782> awake, <WH5782> utter <WH1696> a song! <WH7892> Arise, <WH6965> Barak, <WH1301> and lead away your <WH7628> captives, <WH7617> you son <WH1121> of Abinoam. <WH42>'
"Then a remnant <WH8300> of the nobles <WH117> and the people <WH5971> came down. <WH3068> Yahweh came down for me against <WH7287> the mighty. <WH1368>

Those whose root <WH8328> is in Amalek <WH6002> came out of Ephraim, <WH669> after <WH310> you, <WH1144> Benjamin, among your peoples. <WH5971> Governors <WH2710> come down <WH3381> out of Machir. <WH4353> Those who handle <WH4900> the marshal <WH5608>'s staff <WH7626> came out of Zebulun. <WH2074>

The princes <WH8269> of Issachar <WH3485> were with Deborah. <WH1683> As was Issachar, <WH3485> so was Barak. <WH1301> They rushed <WH7971> into the valley <WH6010> at his feet. <WH7272> By the watercourses <WH6390> of Reuben, <WH7205> there were great <WH1419> resolves <WH2711> of heart. <WH3820>

Why did you sit <WH3427> among <WH996> the sheepfolds, <WH4942> To hear <WH8085> the whistling <WH8292> for the flocks? <WH5739> At the watercourses <WH6390> of Reuben <WH7205> There were great <WH1419> searchings <WH2714> of heart. <WH3820>

Gilead <WH1568> lived <WH7931> beyond <WH5676> the Jordan. <WH3383> Why did Dan <WH1835> remain <WH1481> in ships? <WH591> Asher <WH836> sat still <WH3427> at the haven <WH2348> of the sea, <WH3220> and lived <WH7931> by his creeks. <WH4664>
Zebulun <WH2074> was a people <WH5971> that jeopardized <WH2778> their lives <WH5315> to the deaths; <WH4191> Naphtali <WH5321> also, <WH4791> on the high places of the field. <WH7704>

"The kings <WH4428> came <WH935> and fought, <WH3898> then the kings <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667> fought <WH3898> at Taanach <WH8590> by the waters <WH4325> of Megiddo. <WH4023> They took <WH3947> no plunder <WH1215> of silver. <WH3701>
From the sky <WH8064> the stars <WH3556> fought. <WH3898> From their courses, <WH4546> they fought <WH3898> against Sisera. <WH5516>
The river <WH5158> Kishon <WH7028> swept them away, <WH1640> that ancient <WH6917> river, <WH5158> the river <WH5158> Kishon. <WH7028> My soul, <WH5315> march on <WH1869> with strength. <WH5797>
Then the horse hoofs <WH6119> stamped <WH1986> because of the prancings, <WH1726> the prancings <WH1726> of their strong ones. <WH47>

<WH779> 'Curse Meroz, <WH4789>' said <WH559> the angel <WH4397> of Yahweh. <WH3068> <WH779> 'Curse bitterly <WH779> its inhabitants, <WH3427> because they didn't <WH935> come to help <WH5833> Yahweh, <WH3068> to help <WH5833> Yahweh <WH3068> against the mighty. <WH1368>'
"Jael <WH3278> shall be blessed <WH1288> above women, <WH802> the wife <WH802> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite; <WH7017> blessed <WH1288> shall she be above women <WH802> in the tent. <WH168>
He asked <WH7592> for water. <WH4325> She gave <WH5414> him milk. <WH2461> She brought him <WH7126> butter <WH2529> in a lordly <WH117> dish. <WH5602>

She put <WH7971> her hand <WH3027> to the tent peg, <WH3489> and her right hand <WH3225> to the workmen <WH6001>'s hammer. <WH1989> With the hammer she struck <WH1986> Sisera. <WH5516> She struck through <WH4277> his head. <WH7218> Yes, <WH4272> she pierced and struck through <WH2498> his temples. <WH7541>

At her feet <WH7272> he bowed, <WH3766> he fell, <WH5307> he lay. <WH7901> At her feet <WH7272> he bowed, <WH3766> he fell. <WH5307> Where <WH834> he bowed, <WH3766> there he fell down <WH5307> dead. <WH7703>

"Through the window <WH2474> she looked <WH8259> out, <WH2980> and cried: Sisera <WH5516>'s mother <WH517> looked through the lattice. <WH822> <WH7393> 'Why is his chariot so long <WH954> in coming? <WH935> Why do the wheels <WH6471> of his chariots <WH4818> wait? <WH309>'
Her wise <WH2450> ladies <WH8282> answered <WH6030> her, <WH7725> Yes, she returned answer to herself, <WH561>

<WH4672> 'Have they not found, have they not divided <WH2505> the spoil? <WH7998> A lady, <WH7356> two <WH7361> ladies to every <WH7218> man; <WH1397> to Sisera <WH5516> a spoil <WH7998> of dyed <WH6648> garments, <WH7998> a spoil of dyed <WH6648> garments embroidered, <WH7553> of dyed <WH6648> garments embroidered on both sides, <WH7553> on the necks <WH6677> of the spoil? <WH7998>'

"So let all your enemies <WH341> perish, <WH6> Yahweh, <WH3068> but let those who love <WH157> him be as the sun <WH8121> when it rises forth <WH3318> in its strength. <WH1369>" Then the land <WH776> had rest <WH8252> forty <WH705> years. <WH8141>
